Cluster the Grids

With the clustering configuration set in config_clustering the clustering is performed in the three functions:

classification.clustering.clustering_algorithms.kmedoids_clustering(df_parameters_of_grids: ~pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, list_of_clustering_parameters: list, n_clusters: int) -> (<class 'pandas.core.frame.DataFrame'>, <class 'pandas.core.frame.DataFrame'>)

Clustering the grids with kmedoids algorithm

Parameters

df_parameters_of_gridsDataFrame

Grids with parameters to be clustered

list_of_clustering_parameterslist of strings

Parameters used for clustering.

n_clusters: int

Number of clusters.

Returns

Dataframe:

Grids that are attributed to a cluster.

Dataframe:

Grids that are medoids (cluster centers).

classification.clustering.clustering_algorithms.gmm_tied_clustering(df_parameters_of_grids: ~pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, list_of_clustering_parameters: list, n_clusters: int) -> (<class 'pandas.core.frame.DataFrame'>, <class 'pandas.core.frame.DataFrame'>)

Clustering the grids with gmm tied algorithm

Parameters

df_parameters_of_gridsDataFrame

Grids with parameters to be clustered

list_of_clustering_parameterslist of strings

Parameters used for clustering.

n_clusters: int

Number of clusters.

Returns

Dataframe:

Grids that are attributed to a cluster.

Dataframe:

Grids that are medoids (cluster centers).

classification.clustering.clustering_algorithms.kmeans_clustering(df_parameters_of_grids: ~pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, list_of_clustering_parameters: list, n_clusters: int) -> (<class 'pandas.core.frame.DataFrame'>, <class 'pandas.core.frame.DataFrame'>)

Clustering the grids with kmeans algorithm

Parameters

df_parameters_of_gridsDataFrame

Grids with parameters to be clustered

list_of_clustering_parameterslist of strings

Parameters used for clustering.

n_clusters: int

Number of clusters.

Returns

Dataframe:

Grids that are attributed to a cluster.

Dataframe:

Grids that are centroids (cluster centers).

In each of the functions above the following function is called:

classification.clustering.clustering_algorithms.reindex_cluster_indices(df_parameters_of_grids: ~pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, representative_networks: ~pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) -> (<class 'pandas.core.frame.DataFrame'>, <class 'pandas.core.frame.DataFrame'>)

sort the cluster indices by the representatives networks number of households ascending. this means the representative grid of cluster index 0 has the least number of households

Parameters:

  • df_parameters_of_grids (pd.DataFrame) – set of parameters for grids that are clustered and thus have a column named ‘clusters’

  • representative_networks (pd.DataFrame) – set of representative grids

Returns:

df_parameters_of_grids with re-indexed clusters

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

Returns:

representative_networks with re-indexed clusters

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

This is a feature for better interpretability of the returned representative grids and grid parameters.

The cluster results can be made visiualised in QGIS by running:

classification.database_communication.DatabaseCommunication.DatabaseCommunication.save_transformers_with_classification_info()

write clusters of algorithms kmedoid, kmeans, gmm tied to database table transformer classified, set clustering parameters in config_clustering
